column4: once a person does a fresh install of breezy, do they update it and upgrade same as Debian?  apt-get update and apt-get upgrade ?
once a person does a fresh install of breezy, what other steps should they do besides  apt-get update and apt-get upgrade ?
that should be good untill you want to install more programs then what ubuntu comes with
you also might want to install your video card drivers if you have ATI or nVidia
how do you install drivers for ATI or nVidia?
yes, i dout youd hear otherwise here tho
what video card are you using, either one the how to can be found at wiki.ubuntu.com
does breezy contain the latest security pathes etc, safe to use for internet banking etc?  Latest firefox etc?
yes, when updates come out online, you will be notified and asked if you want to install them
so if you type apt-get update each day, you will make sure its got the latest updates etc?
no, there is an applet in gnome that will do it for you
lightbright: no, there is an applet in gnome that will do it for you <--- does this listen by itself all the time?
yea, you should have seen it when you first booted ubuntu
I like gnome tho, very straight forward
